content.description:
Sit start on the obvious low ledge, right in the middle of the boulder. Move up left and climb up the crack feature. Top out over the lip.

Getting off the ground can be tricky. Often slippery feet from spray paint graffiti. A couple loose holds near the bottom, but overall good quality rock.
content.protection:
Pad.

Can comfortably be climbed w/o pad though. Flat landing.
content.location: In the middle of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start in the pit. Crux is getting off the ground with poor feet. Drift up and left to a flat sloper/jug, then top out.
content.location: Rocky pit at the Westernmost tip of the Stonewall rock cluster. About ~20 feet right from the end of the main Stonewall face and the Bulge. There's currently a spray painted cross/plus sign at the start of the route.

content.description: traverse the face inside the small stonewall.
content.protection: a pad or spotter might help.

content.description: Scrunchy sit start matched on the right low jug rail, hit a right hand crimp and crank left hand to a sloper rail (see picture). Easier climbing gains the top. Asks how comfortable you are cranking on a 10mm edge
content.location: Middle right side of the Stonewall face

climbs.name: Buy Me Lunch
climbs.fa: Unknown might be in bay area rock

content.description:
I thought this was already in MP. Traverse the whole rock going high and top out on the far left. This is similar to Buy Me Dinner but you go high on the slopers and crimps.

P.S. I don't know the name or the FA if anyone does please tell me so I can put it in.
content.protection: a person to move the pad maybe.
content.location: Stonewall rock starting on the underclings for the bulge and traverse from right to left.

content.description: A low to the ground traverse from right to left. Start just left of the boulder leaning against Stonewall on jugs. Staying under the crack system, move left through good sidepulls and underclings, utilizing a large right facing flake to get around the arete to a left hand graffitied crimp knob thingy. Drop down and match on two side by side right facing crimps, then drop even further into an undercling system and traverse left to a good jug rail. Trust your feet and fight through the last 10 feet on slopers and sidepulls until the angle eases off into slab and top out on glory jugs.
content.protection: No pad necessary, your feet are never more than a foot or so off the ground until the topout
content.location: Starts on the right side of the Stonewall boulder just left of the boulder leaning against it and traverse left

content.description: sit start in center of face in the cave/corridor on the backside of the stonewall boulder.
content.protection: pads? and t.p. for your bunghole

content.description: Start on good edges and pull onto desperate sloapers and side pulls till you can make a frantic lunge for the rounded top. Short but stout.
content.location: On the far Right side of the Stone Wall boulder just before the entrance to the cave. Usually well chalked.
